intro: Ruschia muricata, commonly known as the spiked Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit and produces showy, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and red. Its leaves are fleshy and covered in fine, hair-like structures, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Ruschia muricata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
